comments.body: I support this massively. It is so unbelievably frustrating that the cursor stays in the same place you last had it. I just accidentally spent 40 emeralds on a book I didn't need because the game lagged and I rightclicked twice on the villager and instantly traded whatever my mouse was over.
Many .ahk files on GitHub and the Onix Client is adding this feature to Minecraft Bedrock
The giant is not on java edition, it was removed before the beta even came out.

All of these mobs are in Java, but they are unused, hence the title. I don't see much of a use for adding them until they do have a use, unless of course you have some ideas you want to use them for. Still, Mojang may not consider putting them in Bedrock until they have a use for them
Can the killer rabbit be a separate mob/entity from the normal rabbit. And that along with the illusioner can have their own spawn eggs too.

Don't understand why we get the giant, AI-less ravager, giant brown rabbit, weapon-less piglins, and speedy zombies, but no killer bunny, giant, or illusioner. The giant is pretty useless right now, but at least add the illusioner. It is a really cool mob that can be used for map-building.

Add the Killer Bunny because it is so iconic.
This needs to happen soon.
Oh wait, I'm a bedrock player and I didn't even realize what you were talking about, but that should be in Java!

Um... I play Xbox all the time and you are able to swap out the armor you are wearing for the armor in your hand using the left trigger. I don't know about other versions though. If this isn't currently in the game then I am all for this.
Java Edition also allows many more features for text though, including custom Hex Codes that wouldn't work with just a section sign and a number 1-9. MC Stacker makes it easy.
The section symbols are legacy and will be ultimately removed from both versions. Java already has a more powerful replacement, Bedrock does not yet.

I fully agree.
The only question is why the Illagers leave their iron armor? They're not wearing it.
Nobody fights with a sword there either.
Illagers don't show if they're wearing armor. As for the sword, I have no clue.
Why isn't there a downvote option?
Notepad++
I think it already is for all the platforms I’ve played on.
On Bedrock it has a small gap. On console it has a colossal gap
It being at the bottom of the screen would make it harder for mobile users to tap. It's not a big deal and should be kept the way it is for mobile (maybe not for other Bedrock input methods, though)

Husband tried the wither glitch in the End. Didn't work and we gained a wither at spawn. 3 hours later and many despawned swords, bows, and armor from the hunting party later. It finally died but it really, really sucked. I don't bother with the wither if I don't HAVE to because its such a pain.
Mojang should just make Withers stronger on Java Edition, I think, because it too easy to kill it on here so Wither don't even feels like a boss.

Yo creo que debe ser al revés, además el de Java es muy aburrido y el de bedrock muy entretenido, además cuando añadieron el wither de bedrock lo hubiesen hecho como en Java si fuera muy poderoso pero es muy simple el de Java, además es un jefe y los jefes son difíciles no fáciles :v

No, I think they should make the wither on java as hard as on bedrock. It would add more of a challange and besides its already possible to trap and easily kill the wither with the end portal in the end.
I think they need to buff the java wither, as it’s so easy to cheese, where-as on bedrock, it’s an actual challenge.
I hate the book always loaded opened.

soooooooooooo smart !

I need this!!!!!!!!

It would just be easier to add java redstone.

It's easier, a lot more consistent and no one really likes bedrock redstone
You know this is really smart. This way we won't have to relearn redstone.

I've had the same thought for quite some time! Because imagine all the Bedrock players who have seen a really cool redstone creation and decided to build it for themselves, only for it to malfunction completely despite following the design perfectly! After hours of questioning their work, they finally realize the problem:
It was built in Java edition.

I feel like the simplest solution is to add a game setting to choose between Bedrock redstone mechanics and Java redstone mechanics (i.e. Quasi connectivity). That way, Bedrock players can finally create all of the redstone machines and devices that Java players have used for the longest time, while experts in Bedrock redstone can keep using the system they're most familiar with and assure that all their past creations will work just fine.

I think Java players should also have the option to switch between redstone mechanics if they wanted to. The option shouldn't be considered a cheat, as it wouldn't be fair to deny survival players of any platform the redstone system they desire.
I really hope this idea comes trough once!
we NEED this!!!!
nope, bedrock deserves to keep at least one good thing to defend against the huge monster made of java exclusives
im refuse
bedrock deserve to keep this
Java already have a cool parity
so its better that in java doesnt have that

This would help with building early game before you can access scaffolding as well as in creative mode.

This also would be great for accessibility simply because having to sneak over the edge is slow and trying to do fancy bridging like those on Java where they click their mouse fast isn't always possible and can hurt your wrist. This would level the playing field and lower the bar of entry for players with accessibility issues to play and bridge.
YES THIS IS SO USEFUL BUT ALSO ADD REPAIRING AS WELL
What about the Text glowing like how you can dye to text any color.
Dolphins already play with items, they always did.
Fallen trees feel like they'd make a great addition to forests just to break things up a bit

This Is Very Very Much Needed Not Only for java Parity but for creative building.Plus This Would add lots more variation to chest placing in your worlds. Unlike Now Where can Only do it When you Place a chest Next to A trapped Chest.This Needed To be the same. On Bedrock.
I forgot they didn’t appear on java but I wish they did
The huge mushrooms should also generate on water as well.
Why servers are not working in minecraft pocket edition 1.16.210.53?
if something will die that is java

I agree with you, Bedrock Sucks If I had to play a console edition. I would with no questions asked revert back to the legacy editions Xbox 360 Edition all the way. The Redstone made sense, and the joys of quasi connectivity were a thing. Other than the Redstone one of the biggest turn off from bedrock for me is the Minecraft store micro-transaction thing they have going on, everything on Java is made for the players by the players
Bedrock edition is better than java in its own ways too, and it shouldn't be removed.

BEDROCK FREAKING SUCKS. PERIOD! All my tamed animals despawned. One of the Named pet despawned. Axes really do suck. Friends trying to connect to my server is never smooth. Got to reload the server every time. Also, you have to use money for some content in Bedrock. Though most of those content should just be free. Never had any of these problems until Bedrock Edition.  The ONLY reason I play it now is for the RAY TRACING.

Bedrock Edition is not that worst then you think because there are so many GOOD things in Bedrock Edition that Java didn’t have e.g:baby squids.

I think you need to just add hypixel to Bedrock Edition to make it even better then before,is it a good idea Mojang?

Look I understand your concern, however bedrock is unique in it's own way. Many features on bedrock is not on Java, just as many features on Java are not available on Bedrock. I personally feel like while they should be closer together, they should also stay unique. I understand that from some points Java is way better than bedrock. But for other people bedrock is better.
They should have better parity, same features, less divisive for which version to play for whichever reasons.

We shouldnt get rid of Bedrock because the server game isnt as big on it. Thats stupid. Also there are different servers for Bedrock Edition because Bedrock and Java use completley different coding languages. Also how would you feel if I wanted to dissolve Java because it didnt have potion cauldrons or armor stands with hands. Also the combat update hasnt happened on Bedrock, so you really have been using a sword instead. Not all platforms can run the Java coding language. Bedrock exists out of necessity. I know that a lot of things feel different, but that is due to the nature of both vesions. Could you please at least beat the game til the ender dragon on Bedrock and give it an honest shot?
Vote for your own idea! I agree!
it would be awsome

I'm sorry, but I don't agree with your decision.
For example, if someone can't buy Minecraft.
This is a very common problem today. It is better to adhere to stability.

I agree 100 percent. I play Bedrock, and I tried to join my world on another PC without knowing the difference. Surprise, surprise, that doesn't work. Also, your comment makes little sense, MAyna.
This would be very helpful!

The tick delay is VERY helpful in bedrock and can be even further useful in Java. With this its possible to make counters and keep track of things without going tick by tick, meaning maps where entities will be doing specific things will be easier to make

Yep, better to split into commands:
/locate desertpyramid - Desert Temple
/locate swamphut - Swamp Hut
/locate junglepyramid - Jungle Temple
YES! That is SO annoying. I was trying to use the /locate command, and I ended up at a mineshaft and two igloos. These structures should definitely be ungrouped.
This would be nice but I doubt it's going to happen. Minecraft Bedrock is basically the universal console edition now.

This is in the current full release for Java. The sapling has to be within 2 blocks of a flower to have a 5% chance of spawning a nest. This allows people to have tree farms and to plant trees w/o having to worry about bee spawns if they don't want them. This is an important feature of the buzzy bees update. Please don't leave the bedrock community in the dust. 1.14.3 ftw!

Also, this should be in Java Parity.
It was added in beta 1.15.0.51, but they didn't mention it in the changelog
I agree, Bedrock needs TNT bombers too! IT's not like we can use wither cages, since those are broken too.
Why isn't this already implemented?
But bones make more sense. Just because its different on bedrock means its a bug. In my opinion Java should get this bedrock feature.
